meanings.definition: To rezone (an area) to a lower density or less intensive use.
meanings.sent1: The city council decided to downzone the residential area to make it less crowded.
meanings.sent2: The government plans to downzone the industrial zone to create more green spaces.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood was surprised when the city announced they would downzone the park into a parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The decision to downzone the forest felt like cutting down a majestic tree.
meanings.sent5: The community protested the attempt to downzone the playground, fearing it would ruin their children's play area.

meanings.sent1: The downzone of the commercial district led to protests from business owners.
meanings.sent2: After the downzone, the neighborhood saw a decrease in traffic and noise.
meanings.sent3: The downzone of the park was met with confusion as people wondered why it was necessary.
meanings.sent4: The sudden downzone of the residential area felt like a storm sweeping through the community.
meanings.sent5: The city's decision to downzone the historic district left many residents feeling uncertain about the future.
